intro: Helicteres guanaiensis, commonly known as Guanaiense Hairy False Cane, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
